intro: Cyclanthera boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian bitter apple, is a climbing vine native to South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces small, green, bitter fruits that are typically not eaten by humans. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with five petals. Cyclanthera boliviensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
